snippet: Smartphone programs devised to connect cabbies and passengers accounted for fewer than 1 percent of all taxi rides in the first month of the program in New York.
abstract: Smartphone apps devised to connect New York City taxicabs with passengers accounted for fewer than 1 percent of all taxi rides in first month of program; of roughly 1117,000 requests made, only 17 percent were successful in getting a passenger into a cab using the apps--in other cases a driver or passenger canceled or the pickup was rejected.
lead_paragraph: Smartphone programs devised to connect cabbies and passengers accounted for fewer than 1 percent of all taxi rides in the first month of the program in New York.

headline.main: Slow Start for Taxi-Hailing Apps, City Data Show
headline.print_headline: Slow Start for Taxi Apps, City Data Show
